1.comment: Brandon Pettigrew also took part in the passing game, catching 4 balls for 40 yards.

2.comment: Brandon Pettigrew didn't catch a single pass.    Culpepper and Stanton were too inept to get

3.comment: Brandon Pettigrew, who caught 7 balls for 70 yards and a touchdown.

4.comment: Brandon Pettigrew in the end zone for the game-winning touchdown. Good job, <strike>officials and Mangina</strike> Lions!!    It'll be a shame if Stafford is out for a while because he just had a great performance, going 26-of-43 for 422 yards, 5 touchdowns and 2 picks. After that 5.interception debaclation at Seattle, Stafford has turned it around the past 2 weeks. The good news is that the injury was to his non-throwing shoulder.    Stafford's 5 scores all went to different targets: Calvin Johnson (7 catches, 161 yards), Brandon Pettigrew (6 catches, 72 yards), Aaron Brown, Will Heller and Kevin Smith.

5.comment: Brandon Pettigrew, meanwhile, had 7 catches for 108 yards.

6.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (6-44) both posted solid numbers. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

7.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (8-91) and Tony Scheffler (6-63) were Hill's primary targets aside from Megatron.

8.comment: Brandon Pettigrew hauled in Stafford's other score.

10.comment: Brandon Pettigrew: 6 Nate Burleson: 5 Javhid Best: 5 Maurice Morris: 2 Rashied Davis: 1 Tony Scheffler: 1 (and 1 screen pass ruled a lateral) Maurice Stovall: 1 Titus Young: 1 Will Heller: 1    Megatron was more dominant than his numbers indicate. He caught 6 passes for 88 yards and 2 scores. The Bucs had no answer for him; not even Talib.    Javhid Best was the Lions' primary back against Tampa Bay. Best ran for 72 yards on 21 carries (3.4 average) while catching 4 passes for 42 yards. The Bucs defense was able to contain Best.    Tight end Brandon Pettigrew came close to having a big game. He almost had a couple of touchdowns, and he should have a productive season for Detroit. Pettigrew finished with 57 yards on 4 catches.    Wide receiver Nate Burleson also had an effective game for Detroit with catching all 5 of his targets for 60 yards.    For Tampa Bay, quarterback

16.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (2-13) chipped in by hitting a ref.

17.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (6-57, TD) and Titus Young (4-87, TD) had a drop each, but obviously performed well otherwise.

18.comment: Brandon Pettigrew and Burleson then twice to Johnson on 4 consecutive plays to pick up 85 yards in a flash. The 48-yard bomb to Megatron was stunning because he was able to beat a secondary protecting a lead deep. After a holding penalty on left tackle

19.comment: Brandon Pettigrew, who was covered closely by linebacker Nile Diggs, for a 7-yard touchdown. Detroit's defense was playing well, while the Lions' offense was finding massive openings in the Chargers' zone coverage. Stafford converted a 3rd-and-19 with a 30-yard pass to

20.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (7-116), Tony Scheffler (4-65, TD), Titus Young (4-24, 2 TDs), James Jones (6-89), Jermichael Finley (7-64, TD) and Donald Driver (2-52, TD).

21.comment: Brandon Pettigrew hauled in 5 balls for 77 yards. He dropped a touchdown, ultimately leading to 1 of Stafford's 3 interceptions.

22.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (3-18) and the pick. - The 49ers nailed a field goal late in the first quarter, but the Lions were whistled for running into the kicker. This gave San Francisco a free first down, which eventually led to a trip into the end zone. - The Lions had an opportunity to force a long-yardage situation on the first play of the first half, but were whistled for an unnecessary face mask. - Detroit challenged down by contact, which gave them 6 yards on third-and-long. They won the review, but were immediately whistled for a false start afterward, so the entire, 10-minute process resulted in a net of 1 yard.    The Lions' offensive struggles didn't affect

25.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (3-38) and Titus Young (2-6) both disappointed.

27.comment: Brandon Pettigrew had 4 grabs but for just 22 yards.

29.comment: Brandon Pettigrew left the game with an injury. With Pettigrew, Ryan Broyles, Nate Burleson and Titus Young all out, Stafford had no 1 to throw to besides

30.comment: Brandon Pettigrew lost a fumble. The team burned a timeout in the beginning of the third quarter. Basically another day at the office for this team. The Lions look great at times, but these errors will cost them games down the road. They're just fortunate that the Vikings made similar mental mistakes.    It really helped the Lions that Ponder was so inept. He went 18-of-28 for 236 yards, 1 touchdown, 3 picks and a fumble. He didn't even attempt a pass in the first quarter, as the coaching staff clearly doesn't trust him. Plus, there's always

31.comment: Brandon Pettigrew has been phased out of the offense. Stafford threw to him twice on the opening drive, but that was it.    As mentioned, defenders were bouncing off Bell as if he were Jim Brown. He generated 63 rushing yards (20 carries), 69 receiving yards (4 catches) and a touchdown.    Bell's counterpart also scored.

32.comment: Brandon Pettigrew led the team with 59 receiving yards (4 catches). Yes, Brandon freaking Pettigrew.

33.comment: Brandon Pettigrew (3-31) and Bush, whose 8 catches for 30 receiving yards complemented his 92 rushing yards and touchdown on 21 carries. Bush wasn't perfect though; in addition to losing that aforementioned fumble, he also dropped a pass, which has been a problem for him this year.    As for the Cowboys' offense, they had to rely on big plays to score in this contest. They had trouble sustaining drives - 3-of-13 on third downs - because Detroit put immense pressure on Romo. It seemed like he was being blasted on almost every single attempt, which would explain why he was only able to complete half of his passes. He went 14-of-30 for 206 yards and 3 touchdowns. Two of Romo's scores went to Bryant (3-72), who broke free with a 50-yard scamper along the sidelines and also had a David Tyree-esque catch in which he pinned the ball to the side of his helmet.

36.comment: Brandon Pettigrew committed a false start on second down and then proceeded to drop a touchdown. Pettigrew, who shouldn't have been playing in the first place, finished with 1 catch for 6 yards. -
